alert.note: Alert for Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:14PM EDT until June 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR COOK...BERRIEN...LANIER...COLQUITT...TIFT AND SOUTHEASTERN WORTH COUNTIES... At 514 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ty Ty to 6 miles southeast of Moultrie, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. Trees have been blown down in northern Colquitt county. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tifton, Nashville, Moultrie, Adel, Lakeland, Sparks, Enigma, Omega, Ray City, Norman Park, Lenox, Ty Ty, Alapaha, Phillipsburg, Unionville, Riverside, Meigs, Berlin, Sumner and Cecil. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
